messageBody:
"javainsel" <javainsel@...> wrote:
> 1. How would you call the test cases: xxxTest or TestXXX?

I name them like "_xxxTest" (so if I were testing "String", I'd call the
test "_StringTest"). The underscore makes it easy for me to see which
classes in a package are tests and which are not.


> 3. Would you use class variables to improve perforamance of the
> tests? Or would you not do that because it can mess up the test or
> make it difficult to read?

Class variables won't improve the performance of the test, because the test
case class is re-instantiated before each test method is called. For
example, if your test class is called ColorTest and has two methods,
testBlue() and testGreen(), then JUnit will execute them like this
(expressed as a Java program for lack of a better way):

Test x = new ColorTest();
x.setUp();
x.testBlue();
x.tearDown();
x = new ColorTest();
x.setUp();
x.testGreen();
x.tearDown();



Erik Hanson
